pli-tv-bu-vb-pc20:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc20:0.5.eng: 20. The training rule on containing living beings

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc20:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā āḷaviyaṃ viharati aggāḷave cetiye.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc20:1.1.eng: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Āḷavī at the Aggāḷava Shrine,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc20:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena āḷavakā bhikkhū navakammaṃ karontā jānaṃ sappāṇakaṃ udakaṃ tiṇampi mattikampi siñcantipi siñcāpentipi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc20:1.2.eng: the monks there were doing building work. They poured water that they knew contained living beings onto grass and clay, and they had others do the same.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc20:1.3.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc20:1.3.eng: The monks of few desires complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc20:1.4.pli: “kathañhi nāma āḷavakā bhikkhū jānaṃ sappāṇakaṃ udakaṃ tiṇampi mattikampi siñcissantipi siñcāpessantipī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc20:1.4.eng: “How can the monks at Āḷavī pour water that they know contains living beings onto grass and clay, and have others do the same?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc20:1.5.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū āḷavake bhikkhū anekapariyāyena vigarahitvā bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc20:1.5.eng: After rebuking those monks in many ways, they told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned the monks:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc20:1.6.pli: “saccaṃ kira tumhe, bhikkhave, jānaṃ sappāṇakaṃ udakaṃ tiṇampi mattikampi siñcathapi siñcāpethapī”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc20:1.6.eng: “Is it true, monks, that you do this?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc20:1.9.pli: kathañhi nāma tumhe, moghapurisā, jānaṃ sappāṇakaṃ udakaṃ tiṇampi mattikampi siñcissathapi siñcāpessathapi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc20:1.9.eng: “Foolish men, how can you do this?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc20:1.11.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc20:1.11.eng: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc20:1.12.1.pli: “Yo pana bhikkhu jānaṃ sappāṇakaṃ udakaṃ tiṇaṃ vā mattikaṃ vā siñceyya vā siñcāpeyya vā, pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc20:1.12.1.eng: ‘If a monk pours water that he knows contains living beings onto grass or clay, or has it poured, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc20:2.1.4.eng: …The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc20:2.1.6.pli: sāmaṃ vā jānāti. Aññe vā tassa ārocenti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc20:2.1.6.eng: he knows by himself or others have told him.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc20:2.1.8.eng: if he pours it himself, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc20:2.1.10.eng: if he asks another, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc20:2.1.11.pli: Sakiṃ āṇatto bahukampi siñcati, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc20:2.1.11.eng: If he only asks once, then even if the other pours a lot, he commits one offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc20:2.1.11.comm: “A lot” renders bahukaṁ. This is based on the commentary to Bu Pc 10, Sp 2.86: Sakiṁ āṇatto bahukampi khaṇatīti sacepi sakaladivasaṁ khaṇati, āṇāpakassa ekaṁyeva pācittiyaṁ, “Sakiṁ āṇatto bahukampi khaṇatīti: there is only one offense entailing confession for the one who asks, even if the other digs the entire day.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc20:2.2.1.pli: Sappāṇake sappāṇakasaññī tiṇaṃ vā mattikaṃ vā siñcati vā siñcāpeti vā, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc20:2.2.1.eng: If it contains living beings, and he perceives it as such, and he pours it onto grass or clay, or he has it poured, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc20:2.2.2.pli: Sappāṇake vematiko tiṇaṃ vā mattikaṃ vā siñcati vā siñcāpeti vā, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc20:2.2.2.eng: If it contains living beings, but he is unsure of it, and he pours it onto grass or clay, or he has it poured, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc20:2.2.3.pli: Sappāṇake appāṇakasaññī tiṇaṃ vā mattikaṃ vā siñcati vā siñcāpeti vā, anāpatti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc20:2.2.3.eng: If it contains living beings, but he does not perceive it as such, and he pours it onto grass or clay, or he has it poured, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc20:2.2.4.eng: If it does not contain living beings, but he perceives it as such, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc20:2.2.5.eng: If it does not contain living beings, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc20:2.2.6.eng: If it does not contain living beings, and he does not perceive it as such, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc20:2.3.6.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc20:2.3.7.eng: The training rule on containing living beings, the tenth, is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc20:2.3.8.eng: The second subchapter on plants is finished.
